Key Match Events: Jos Buttler hit 73 from 47 balls to lift his side to 179-6
Ben Stokes dismissed Kane Williamson for 40 from 40 balls
Sam Curran had Glenn Phillips caught at long-on for 62 from 36 balls
Pre-Game Insights: England survived under intense pressure to successfully defend 179 at the Gabba
Post-Match Reflections: England will qualify for the semi-finals if they beat Sri Lanka on Saturday, as long as Australia do not beat Afghanistan a day earlier and also overturn England’s significant net run-rate advantage
Miscellaneous Highlights: The fact England’s match comes 24 hours after Australia helps their cause as they will have a clear picture of any net run-rate requirements going into their final game
